result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Berry D Williams

records.addlTxt:
11:13 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Berry D Williams in court.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Berry D Williams. 

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing December 1, 2022.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM Defendant Berry D Williams in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing December 1, 2022. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant . Form emailed to Dept of State. No passport.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. If defendant has a passport, Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

2:09 PM Defendant Berry D Williams in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
